revised_title: Electrochemical Changes and Their Relations to Electrical Effects
tldr: The author, Humphry Davy, discusses the relations between electrical and chemical changes, focusing on the decomposition of water by the voltaic pile. He explains the effects of different combinations of metals and fluids, and how chemical changes restore equilibrium. Davy also explores the accumulation of electricity in voltaic arrangements and the reactions that occur when the circuit is broken or changed.
